dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in still pools to swift flowing streams with pebble or boulder substrates, seldom over sand.  Has not been found in silted rivulets flowing into mainstream.  More sedentary than D. malabaricus.  Forms groups of 3-5 individuals slowly moving near the surface.  Probably feeds on insects.  Aquarium fish exporters voluntarily refrained from collecting this species until it was better understood and bred commercially.  Collected in moderate numbers.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Nilwala River basin, Opatha, Sri Lanka.
dataObjects.references: Pethiyagoda, R. 1991 Freshwater fishes of Sri Lanka. The Wildlife Heritage Trust of Sri Lanka, Colombo. 362 p. (Ref. 6028)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Conspicuous color pattern consisting of some 7-11 irregular, parallel, dark blue vertical bars on the anterior part of the sides and a short longitudinal stripe on caudal peduncle, continued in the median caudal rays (Ref. 6874).Description:  Dorsal fin with 3 simple and 11-12 branched rays; anal fin with 3 simple and 13-15 branched rays; pectoral fin with one simple and 11-13 branched rays; and pelvic fin with one simple and 7 branched rays (Ref.  6874).
